title: High-Protein Marry Me Chicken
description: Restaurant-quality pan-seared chicken in a creamy sun-dried tomato sauce with proper technique and protein-forward balance.
instructions: Season chicken; sear in hot oil until golden; remove and rest.
Sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) garlic and sun-dried tomatoes; deglaze with broth, reduce briefly.
Add half-and-half; simmer to coat-spoon consistency; whisk in Parmesan.
Return chicken to sauce; simmer gently to finish; garnish with basil.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 25–35g protein per serving meets athlete needs
Technique-forward cooking teaches valuable kitchen skills
Family-favorite appeal encourages repeat meals

title: Cottage Cheese Baked Ziti
description: Comfort food classic upgraded with cottage cheese for higher protein and better texture, using proper parcooking and sauce reduction.

ingredients.notes: Parcook 6 minutes; using full box prevents waste

instructions: Reduce marinara until slightly thick; brown meat; parcook pasta.
Layer pasta, reduced sauce, meat, cottage cheese, and mozzarella; repeat; top with Parmesan.
Bake at 375°F for 25–30 minutes until bubbly and lightly golden; rest 10 minutes before slicing.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Higher protein than standard ziti supports athletes
Make-ahead casserole improves with time and serves a crowd
Teaches reduction and layering techniques

title: Ground Turkey Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Technique-driven stuffed peppers with proper sweating of aromatics and moisture control for non-watery stuffing.
instructions: Sweat onion and garlic in oil; add turkey and brown; stir in reduced tomato and rice.
Par-bake pepper halves 10 minutes at 375°F; fill with stuffing.
Bake 20–25 minutes until peppers are tender-crisp.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ protein per serving with satisfying texture
Family-friendly flavors encourage repeat requests
Teaches moisture control for better casseroles

title: Pizza Frittata
description: Egg-based frittata finished under the broiler for proper texture contrast; pizza flavors win over families.
instructions: Heat oven-safe skillet (12-inch if available); add oil and eggs; sprinkle cheese and pepperoni.
Cook gently until almost set; broil 1–2 minutes to finish top; rest 5 minutes before slicing.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein family dish with familiar flavors
Broiler finish teaches professional texture control

title: White Bean & Smoked Sausage Skillet
description: Hearty skillet that emphasizes proper searing and sauce development for comfort-food satisfaction.
instructions: Sear sausage to develop fond (browned bits on pan); remove.
Sauté onion and garlic; deglaze with broth and reduce until slightly thickened.
Return sausage and beans; simmer briefly and serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Substantial protein and carbs for active athletes
Teaches deglazing and reduction fundamentals

title: Lemon-Brown Butter Salmon Dinner
description: Pan-seared salmon finished with brown butter and lemon, served with roasted vegetables and farro.
instructions: Sear salmon in oil; finish with browned butter and lemon.
Serve with farro and roasted vegetables.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-quality protein and fats support recovery
Teaches searing and beurre noisette fundamentals

title: Indian Butter Chickpeas
description: Aromatic tomato gravy with chickpeas for a protein-forward vegetarian family dinner emphasizing sauce reduction.
instructions: Sweat onion with a pinch of salt; add garlic, ginger; toast spices briefly.
Add tomato puree; reduce to coat spoon; stir in chickpeas; simmer.
Finish with butter and yogurt; adjust salt.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein and carbohydrates in a family-loved sauce
Technique focus builds cooking confidence
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: White Chicken Chili (From-Scratch)
description: Comforting chili using proper sautéing and seasoning balance; high-protein and meal-prep friendly.
instructions: Sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) onion in oil; add garlic; add chicken and cook through (165°F).
Stir in beans, broth, chiles, spices; simmer 20 minutes; adjust seasoning.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-forward chili with crowd-pleasing flavor
Batch yields leftovers for busy weeks
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Sweet & Sour Tofu (Technique-Focused)
description: Proper tofu prep with cornstarch and pan-frying yields crisp edges; balanced sweet-sour sauce from scratch.
instructions: Coat tofu with cornstarch; pan-fry until crisp; remove.
Sauté pepper and garlic; add vinegar, soy, sugar; simmer; return tofu and pineapple to glaze.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Higher-protein vegetarian option for variety
Teaches moisture management for crisp tofu
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Chicken Stir Fry (Family Technique)
description: Restaurant-style stir fry emphasizing proper searing, timing, and sauce balance for a family favorite.
instructions: Sear chicken in batches; remove.
Stir-fry vegetables; add sauces and cornstarch slurry; return chicken to glaze.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein, balanced dinner with family appeal
Builds core cooking skills for long-term independence
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 1–2 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Sesame Tofu & Broccoli
description: Kid-friendly Asian flavors with proper tofu crisping and sesame finish; pairs well with steamed rice.
instructions: Crisp tofu in oil; remove. Steam-crisp broccoli.
Toss with soy and sesame; return tofu; finish with sesame seeds.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-rich vegetarian meal suitable for athletes
Technique teaches texture control
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Sesame Salmon & Farro Bowls
description: Balanced salmon and farro bowls with herbs and vegetables; teaches grain cookery and fish searing.
instructions: Cook farro; sear salmon until flaky and opaque; assemble bowls with vegetables; drizzle soy and sesame oil.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-quality protein and complex carbs for athletes
Teaches staple techniques for weekly rotation

title: Beef & Rice Stuffed Poblanos
description: From-scratch stuffed poblano peppers with properly reduced tomato base and tender rice for a high-protein family dinner.
instructions: Sweat onion in oil; add garlic; brown beef thoroughly; stir in cumin, reduced tomato, and rice; season.
Par-bake pepper halves 10 minutes at 375°F; fill with stuffing and return to oven 20–25 minutes.
Rest 5 minutes before serving for cleaner slices.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ protein per serving with satisfying textures
Technique-driven results build family cooking skills
Leftovers hold up well for busy training days

title: Miso-Glazed Salmon & Brown Rice
description: Properly seared salmon finished with a miso glaze, served with cucumber salad and brown rice for a balanced family meal.
instructions: Whisk miso, soy, honey, vinegar for glaze.
Sear salmon 2 minutes per side; brush with glaze; briefly cook to set.
Serve over brown rice with cucumber on the side; sprinkle sesame seeds.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-quality protein supports recovery and growth
Balanced carbs from brown rice fuel training
Teaches glazing and searing techniques
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated; up to 2 months frozen. Reheat to 145°F for fish or 165°F for sides.

title: Herb-Roasted Chicken Thighs with Potatoes & Green Beans
description: Classic sheet-pan family dinner focused on proper seasoning and roasting technique for superior flavor and texture.
instructions: Toss potatoes and green beans with half the oil and seasonings; spread on sheet pan.
Rub thighs with remaining oil and seasonings; place over vegetables.
Roast at 425°F for 35–40 minutes until thighs reach 175°F and skin is crisp.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-forward meal with family appeal and leftovers
Teaches roasting fundamentals and seasoning balance
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.
